class.name: Protocol
class.brief: A class that defines a generic protocol.
class.doc:
This class is used for defining a general protocol with remote-function-calls (RPCs) and data feeds. The RPCs are defined from a C++ function signature using any sub class of fetch::rpc::AbstractCallable including fetch::rpc::Function and fetch::rpc::Function and fetch::rpc::CallableClassMember. The feeds are available from any functionality implementation that sub-classes fetch::rpc::HasPublicationFeed.
A current limitation of the implementation is that there is only support for 256 RPC functions. It the next version of this class, this should be changed to be variable and allocated at construction time (TODO).

method.name: Expose
method.brief: Exposes a function or class member function.
method.doc:
The pointer provided is used to invoke the callable when a call matching the identifier is recieved by a service.
In the next implementation of this, one should use unique_ptr rather than a raw pointer. This will have no impact on the rest of the code as it is always a reference return and not the raw pointer (TODO).

argument.name: n
argument.doc: is a unique identifier for the callable being exposed

argument.name: fnc
argument.doc: is a pointer to the callable function.

method.name: feeds
method.brief: Access memeber to the feeds in the protocol.

method.name: operator[]
method.brief: Operator to access the different functions in the protocol.
method.doc:
The result of this operator is a fetch::rpc::Protocol::callable_type that can be invoked in accodance with the definition of an fetch::rpc::AbstractCallable.
This operator throws a <SerializableException> if the index is

argument.name: n
argument.doc: is the idnex of callable in the protocol.

method.name: RegisterFeed
method.brief: Registers a feed from an implementation.

argument.name: publisher
argument.doc: is a class that subclasses fetch::rpc::AbstractPublicationFeed.

method.name: Subscribe
method.doc: This function is intended to be used by the service to subscribe its clients to the feed.

argument.name: id
argument.doc: is the subscription id allocated on the client side.

method.name: Unsubscribe
method.doc: This function is intended to be used by the service to unsubscribe its clients to the feed.

argument.name: id
argument.doc: is the subscription id allocated on the client side.
